name: The Necessity of Hel
description:
Will you cry for the death of the invulnerable god? Or will you ally yourself with the goddess of death? Drive to Helheim and find out.

This is a short Twine game that you can play in your browser. This game originally tried to stay close to the source material, but as I dug deeper, Hel’s character had plans of her own. Do with that what you will.

This game was inspired by:

  • The Devil’s Asshole by Anna Antropy
  • Storyteller Daniel Allison’s retelling of Baldrs draumar
  • Sassafrass’s musical Sundown: Whispers of Ragnarok
  • Moe’s 24h breakfast diner (RIP)
  • a recent visit to a grungy diner (thanks Gab!)
  • Buddy Wakefield’s poem Horsehead 
  • Naomi Mitchison’s novel Travel Light

Just as a note, I started writing this game a few days before Ocean Keltoi’s release of the video Hermodr: The Historical Death Knight. I waited until the game was finished and published before watching it, just to ensure that I didn’t steal any of his ideas. Similarly, I happened upon Black Stone Sanctuary’s two essays on Modgud but waited until I was done with the game before reading these works.

Story by Cardinal. Find more of my work here. Please consider tipping me on ko-fi to help fuel more work like this.

Game-testing by Matt J. McCormick.

Image “Móðguðr Guarding the Bridge” from MyNDIR.
